New Records: Hunter Brown had the most strikeouts by an Astros pitcher in his postseason debut since Mike Scott had 14 in Game 1 of the 1986 National League Championship Series.
Key Match Events: The Tigers rallied for four runs in the eighth inning against Ryan Pressly and Josh Hader.
Pressly bounced a wild pitch in the eighth inning, allowing Kerry Carpenter to score from third with the tying run.
Andy Ibáñez hit a three-run double in the eighth inning to put Detroit ahead.
Hunter Brown struck out nine batters and gave up two hits and one run in his first career postseason start.
Parker Meadows hit a leadoff homer in the sixth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Astros second baseman Jose Altuve expressed heartbreak over the loss and emphasized the need to move on.
First-year Astros manager Joe Espada acknowledged the team's challenging season and expressed pride in their postseason achievement.
Astros outfielder Chas McCormick expressed confidence in the team's future postseason prospects.
Hunter Brown expressed pride in his teammates and the relationships built despite the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros have lost seven consecutive postseason games at home.
The Astros started the season 12-24 and faced a 10-game deficit in the AL West in mid-June before rallying to win their seventh division title in eight seasons.
The Astros played without slugger Kyle Tucker for three months due to a right shin fracture.
